intro: Frankenia × suardii, commonly known as the coastal frankenia, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in dune environments. It has a compact growth habit with multiple stems that produce clusters of small, showy blooms. Frankenia × suardii is well adapted to coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds.
